text: Colin Pask is a British historian of mathematics and popular science writer. == Life == He was born in Great Gonerby, a village near the town of Grantham in Lincolnshire, England. His father was a dairy farmer. == Career == He is currently Emeritus Professor of Mathematical Sciences and History at UNSW Australia. == Bibliography == He has written: * Magnificent Principia: Exploring Isaac Newton's Masterpiece * Great Calculations: A Surprising Look Behind 50 Scientific Inquiries * Math for the Frightened: Facing Scary Symbols and Everything Else That Freaks You Out About Mathematics == References == ==External links== * Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:British historians
